info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 3:15AM EST until further notice by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Chester and Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 315 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. An additional inch of rain is expected. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Phoenixville, West Norriton, Valley Forge, King Of Prussia, Chesterbrook, Audubon, and Devon-Berwyn. - This includes Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 322 and 325. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
